The group demanded a lasting solution to the protracted armed conflict. [size=no report]

source: Cabo Ligado; Mozambique Bulletin Subscribe; Carta de Mocambique

notes: Around 16 February 2022 (week of), OLF Shane militants clashed with ENDF and Oromia regional special police forces around Bule Hora town in Bule Hora (West Guji, Oromia). The militants claimed to have taken control of the Addis Ababa-Kenya highway. Casualties unknown.

actor1: OLF: Oromo Liberation Front (Shane Splinter Faction)
assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of Ethiopia (2018-) Oromo Regional Special Forces
notes: On 16 February 2022, OLF Shane militants clashed with ENDF and regional special police forces in Dago Bite kebele (a location difficult to identify and coded to the admin capital, Awara) in Abuna Ginde Beret woreda (West Shewa, Oromia), killing unidentified number of government troops (coded as 3 in low intensity conflict area) and confiscating various weapons.

Around 16 February 2022 (as reported), a group burned down houses of suspects believed to be behind the cattle rustling in Matunda village near Kiminini (Kiminini, Trans Nzoia county). A section of them, in demonstration, later marched to the chief's office to present their petition over insecurity in the area. [size=no report]

On 16 February 2022, a section of Kyengera Town Council residents blocked the Kampala-Masaka road in Kyengera (Wakiso, Central), demanding the arrest of a policeman who killed a local. The demonstrators carried the coffin containing the remains of the deceased which they placed in the middle of the road. Police officers fired tear gas to disperse the demonstrators and confiscated the coffin. There were no causalities. [size=no report]

On 16 February 2022, more than 50 fish traders marched to the office of Deputy County Commissioner Kisilu Mutua in Karagita area of Naivasha town (Naivasha, Nakuru county) following the fatal shooting of a fellow fisherman by police. Running battles between the group and police ensued. No details on injuries. [size=more than 50]

actor1: OLF: Oromo Liberation Front (Shane Splinter Faction)
notes: On 16 February 2022, OLF-Shane militants ambushed an ENDF military convoy at a unknown location (coded to Ginde Beret) while moving into Ginde Beret woreda (West Shewa, Oromia) resulting in the killing of unknown number of troops. An unidentified number of fatalities mentioned in low intensity conflict is coded as 3.

On 16 February 2022, ethnic Amhara militias raided homes of civilians identified as relatives of OLF leader and abducted 8 people from Gudina Abuna kebele, Horo Buluk woreda (Horro Gudru Wollega, Oromia).
On 16 February 2022, a group of three unidentified armed men kidnapped a thirty-year-old albino woman at her house in the commune of Sakalalina (Ihosy, Ihorombe).

Around 16 February 2022 (as reported), a boda boda driver was killed and his mutilated body was found in a forest near Hiyari (Mtwara, Mtwara). The killing is presumably connected to attacks perpetrated by Mozambican Islamist militia, but it wasn't confirmed. This is the third discovery of a dead boda boda driver in the district of Mtwara.

source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Tamazuj; Juba Monitor; VOA; UNMISS
notes: On 16 February 2022, during two days of fighting, militia from Leer county clashed with militias from Mayendit county in ten unspecified villages in Rubnor and Tutnyang payams (Mayendit county, Unity state) [coded to Gier], killing 23 people (18 from the attackers, who are presumed to be Dok Nuer, and five from the defenders, who are presumed to be Haak Nuer) and wounding 24 (fatalities divided across two events). Livestock was looted and property destroyed. Note that it is probable that these events relate to escalating violence between SPLM-IO, IO Kitgweng, and government forces in Unity state.

notes: On 16 February 2022, clashes between SPLM-IO and SSPDF took place in several unspecified areas in Maiwut and Longochuk (Maiwut county, Upper Nile state) [coded to Maiwut]. The fighting continued for two days. Casualties unknown.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-2022) Special Forces
source: Undisclosed Source; Shabelle Media Network; Radio Kulmiye
notes: On 16 February 2022, government police forces (Har Macad) assaulted and beaten four local journalists, from Somali Cable, Radio Dalsan, and Five Tv, reporting on an Al Shabaab attack at the Kaxda police station in Mogadishu - Daynile (Banadir). The journalists were blindfolded with their hands and legs tied together behind their backs.

assoc_actor_2: Nuer Ethnic Militia (South Sudan); Pastoralists (South Sudan)
notes: On 16 February 2022, suspected Misseriya cattle raiders clashed with local cattle guards (presumed to be Bul Nuer) at Ariel village in Bieh payam (Mayom county, Unity state), with one cattle raider being wounded. Some cattle had been stolen, but were retrieved.

source: Caasimada; Radio Kulmiye; Somali Memo; VOA; Undisclosed Source; Hiiraan (Somalia); Shabelle Media Network; Goobjoob; Radio Dalsan; Radio Risala; Calamada
notes: On 16 February 2022, overnight, Al Shabaab militants attacked Kaxda police station in Mogadishu - Kaxda (Banadir). The attack started with a vehicle Borne IED and followed by heavy exchange of gunfire. Militants briefly took over the police station, stealing two pickup vehicles and later retreated. At least ten people including four soldiers were killed. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.

source: Somali Memo; Radio Dalsan; Radio Kulmiye; Calamada; Caasimada; Hiiraan (Somalia); VOA; Shabelle Media Network; Radio Risala; Goobjoob; Undisclosed Source
notes: On 16 February 2022, overnight, Al Shabaab militants attacked government security forces (SNA) at a checkpoint at the Daru-Salaam village neighborhood in Mogadishu - Daynile (Banadir). The attack started with a vehicle borne IED and followed by heavy exchange of gunfire. The checkpoint attacked was close to the residence of the deputy commissioner of Heliwa district and some reports stated that the target was the deputy commissioner, Al-Shabaab claimed that they attacked the checkpoint. Three soldiers were killed and 16 civilians were injured.

On 16 February 2022, overnight, Al Shabaab militants attacked government security forces (SNA) at a checkpoint at Ceel Janaale area in Mogadishu - Kaxda (Banadir). The checkpoint is located at the entrance of the village. There were no casualties.

On 16 February 2022, overnight, Al Shabaab militants attacked government security forces (SNA) at a checkpoint in Ceelasha Biyaha village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). There were no casualties. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.
On 16 February 2022, overnight, Al Shabaab militants attacked government security forces (SNA) at a checkpoint in Xaawo-Cabdi village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). There were no casualties.
On 16 February 2022, government soldier (SNA) shot and killed a taxi driver in Mogadishu - Wadajir (Banadir). No further details.

On 16 February 2022, overnight, Al Shabaab militants attacked government security forces (SNA) at a checkpoint at the Caymiska village neighborhood in Mogadishu - Yaqshid (Banadir). The attack was initiated with RPG rounds followed by exchange of gunfire from both two sides. There were no casualties.
On 16 February 2022, overnight, Al Shabaab militants attacked government security forces (SNA) at a checkpoint in Mogadishu - Hodan (Banadir). There were no casualties.
On 16 February 2022, overnight, Al Shabaab militants attacked government security forces (SNA) at a checkpoint in Mogadishu - Daynile (Banadir). There were no casualties.

actor1: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
notes: On 16 February 2022, clashes between SPLM-IO and SSPDF took place in several unspecified areas in Maiwut and Longochuk (Longochuk county, Upper Nile state) [coded to Mathiang]. The fighting continued for two days. Casualties unknown.

On 15 February 2022, UPDF soldiers shot and killed a civilian around Arogo village, Kal Parish, Madiopei Town Council, in Kitgum District (Northern). The victim was accused of trying to flee during his arrest. One soldier was arrested by the police.

On 15 February 2022, the Mayor of Kawempe, Emmanuel Sserunjogi, organized a rally in Kawempe (Kampala, Central), to protest the continued detention of Kawempe North MP Muhammed Ssegirinya. Police and army forces intervened, blocked Sserunjogi from accessing the venue, and foiled the rally. [size=no report]

On 15 February 2022, a section of students at Kyambogo University protested in Kyambogo (Central, Kampala), over missing coursework marks. They accused the management of failing to resolve the issue of missing marks in order to impose on them surcharges especially those in the final year. [size=no report]
On 15 February 2022, rioters barricaded roads with burning tires in Aw Bare (Fafan, Somali) following the killing of two students at a checkpoint (coded separately). [size=no report]

actor1: Police Forces of Ethiopia (2018-) Somali Regional Special Forces
notes: On 15 February 2022, Somali Region special police open gunfire on a passenger vehicle in Aw Bare (Fafan, Somali) after the vehicle failed to stop at a checkpoint. Two people (students) were killed.

On 15 February 2022, several people, mainly businessmen and boda boda taxi operators, pelted stones at a fire truck in Kisii town (Nyaribari Chache, Kisii county), claiming that it arrived late following an inferno that consumed property valued at millions of shillings. Police used teargas to disperse the group. [size=several]

actor1: OLF: Oromo Liberation Front (Shane Splinter Faction)
notes: Around 15 February 2022 (week of), OLF-Shane forces clashed with Ethiopian forces (assumed to be Ethiopian military ENDF) in rural areas near Ginde Beret town, West Shewa (Oromia), killing an unspecified number and taking weapons. Unknown fatalities in a non combat zone coded as 3.
On 15 February 2022, an IED by Al Shabaab militants detonated, targeting local authority tax collectors at the animal market in El Wak town (Ceel Waaq, Gedo). There were no casualties.

On 15 February 2022, residents beat up a female student in Nyero (Kumi, Eastern), for allegedly leaving her baby in a pit-latrine. Police forces intervened and saved the victim. [women targeted: girls] [size=no report]

On 15 February 2022, suspected Pokot militia attacked Ng'aratuko village [coded to Ngaratuko, Baringo North, Baringo county], killing one man and stealing 341 animals in a suspected retaliation attack in Loruk (coded separately).
On 15 February 2022, police and military forces fought with a Karamajong militia in Lobel village, Kotido sub-county (Kotido, Northern). Two cattle traders were injured.

Around 15 February 2022 (month of), an IED planted by suspected Al Shabaab militants detonated, targeting a private vehicle along the Milimani and Baure road, near Baure (Lamu East, Lamu county). One person was injured while six others escaped unhurt.

assoc_actor_2: Magabul Clan Group (Somalia); Awramale Clan Group (Somalia); Labour Group (Somalia); Pastoralists (Somalia)
notes: On 15 February 2022, Al Shabaab militants abducted three clan elders and businessmen from Magabul clan and Awramale clan in Jilib town (Jilib, Middle Juba) after a grazing area dispute between the Magabul and Awramale clan groups near Kismaayo airport. The militants called clan elders and businessmen from both clans to Jilib to resolve the dispute.

Property destruction: On 15 February 2022, overnight, unknown attackers (described as criminals from Oguruny), burnt four houses in Iloli village (Torit county, Eastern Equatoria state). The motive believed to be aiming at raiding cattle from the village.

notes: On 15 February 2022, clashes between SPLM-IO and SSPDF took place in several unspecified areas in Maiwut and Longochuk (Maiwut county, Upper Nile state) [coded to Maiwut]. The fighting continued for two days. Casualties unknown.

Around 15 February 2022 (month of), SSPDF gang-raped a woman at her house at an unspecified location in Central Equatoria state, in a report that focuses on sexual violence in the southern part of the state. The event in question has been coded to Lainya town (Lainya county) at GP2, given the high concentration of government troops in the area at the time.

On 15 February 2022, overnight, Al Shabaab militants attacked government security forces (SNA) at a defensive base in Janaale village (Marka, Lower Shabelle). Both sides exchange gunfire. There were no casualties.

On 15 February 2022, overnight, an IED by Al Shabaab militants detonated targeting government soldiers travelling on motorcycles in Lafoole village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). There were no fatalities. Three soldiers were injured.

On 14 February 2022, rioters beat two suspected thieves at Summer Gardens in Mukono (Mukono, Central). One victim died and the other one was saved by police forces. [size=no report]

On 14 February 2022, dozens of torture survivors, likely affiliated to NUP, stormed the Office of the High Commissioner for Human Rights (OHCHR) on Kololo hill, Kampala city (Kampala, Central), protesting the silence of the Uganda Human Rights Commission on torture incidents by security operatives. [size=dozens]

On 14 February 2022, Councilors fought with their fellow Councilors at the Hoima district headquarters in Kasingo cell (Hoima, Western). The fight broke out after a section of councilors opposed the council sitting, saying it was illegal. There were no casualities. [size=no report]
On 14 February 2022, Boda Boda riders beat two suspected thieves in Nansana (Wakiso, Central). One died and the other one was rushed to the nearby hospital. [size=no report]

actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: On 14 February 2022, SNR officers abducted 7 Imbonerakure on Runyonza hill (Kirundo, Kirundo). The victims tried to escape a military training when they found out they were to join other Imbonerakure who are fighting alongside the Burundian army against Red Tabara in the east of the Democratic Republic of Congo.

On 14 February 2022, residents beat a suspected murderer in Angorom Village, Aputir parish, Morukatipe Su-County (Tororo, Eastern). The victim had hacked to death his sister in-law. Police forces intervened and rushed the suspected murderer to the nearby hospital. The rioters stormed the hospital demanding the victim. [size=no report]

On 14 February 2022, over 400 students from Pemwai girls secondary school marched from the institution to Kabarnet town (Baringo central, Baringo county), following the death of two students. They accused the school principal of negligence and called on the county director of education to intervene. [size=over 400]

On 14 February 2022, university students gathered in Thyolo (Thyolo, Southern) in a demonstration against the institution's decision to not allow students with fee debts to complete the end-of-year examinations scheduled to start on the day. [size=no report]

source: Televisao de Mozambique; Carta de Mocambique
notes: On 14 February 2022, a group of people stoned a woman accused of witchcraft to death in Morrumbala (Morrumbala, Zambezia). The woman was accused of spreading cholera. Police was called to help the victim but did not go to the area due to lack of fuel. [size=no report] [women targeted: accused of witchcraft/sorcery]

source: Hiiraan (Somalia); Radio Mogadishu; Radio Risala; Goobjoob; Radio Dalsan; Undisclosed Source; Caasimada; Shabelle Media Network
notes: On 14 February 2022, an IED by Al Shabaab militants detonated, targeting civilians traveling in a rickshaw in Xaanshooley village (Jowhar, Middle Shabelle). Five people including one clan elder and a prominent businessman were killed.

On 14 February 2022, Al Shabaab militants killed a woman, accused of committing adultery with an unmarried man who was also punished with 100 lashes in public gathering in Booco village (Bulo Burto, Hiraan). The man was also expelled from village for one year period.
On 14 February 2022, Zomba rural teachers gathered at the district offices in Zomba (Zomba City, Southern) in a demonstration to demand the payment of late wages [size=no report]

On 14 February 2022, area 49 residents gathered in Lilongwe (Lilongwe City, Central) in a demonstration regarding an alleged illegal acquisition of land by a government official; the land had been previously be reserved for social projects. [size=no report]

Around 14 February 2022 (as reported), community members gathered in Nsanje (Nsanje, Southern) in a demonstration to demand the removal of the local government Chief, accusing him of maladministration. [size=no report]

On 14 February 2022, local residents lynched a Christian man in Kong'asis village, near Cherangani (Cherangany, Trans Nzoia County), allegedly for killing the son of a fellow congregate whom he had a quarrel with and destroying property of a fellow congregant. [size=no report]

On 14 February 2022, a group of teachers and unionists protested in front of the Private Secondary Education Authority (PSEA) against the non-recognition of teaching licenses in Beau Bassin-Rose Hill (Plaines Wilhems). A teacher complained that he tried to join another department and was informed that his qualification was not accepted by the PSEA. [size=no report]

On 14 February 2022, a group of skippers, boarders, parents of students and anti-vaccine supporters protested, demanding the revision of a pension promised by the government and against the loss of purchasing power in front of the government hotel in Port Louis (Port Louis, Port Louis). Students' parents demanded the resignation of the Minister of Education and asked for clarification on a protocol for schools due to coronavirus' restrictions. Protesters also denounced pressure against those who did not wish to be vaccinated against coronavirus. [size=no report]

On 14 February 2022, a group of students protested, demanding the arrest of a young man accused of killing a student who presumably stole a bike in Toamasina (Toamasina I, Atsinanana). The group asked the university officials to suspend the courses and activities at their campus at the University of Toamasina. The students closed the administrative offices (through unspecified means). [size=no report]
On 14 February 2022, ENDF troops shot and killed a high school student in Shikute town, Jeldu woreda (West Shewa, Oromia). The reason for the attack is unknown.

On 14 February 2022, Amhara ethnic militias attacked and killed unknown number of residents in several unknown locations (difficult to identify and coded to a district capital, Amuru) in Amuru woreda (Horo Gudru Wollega, Oromia), displacing hundreds of people from the area. An unidentified number of fatalities mentioned in low intensity conflict area is coded as 3.

notes: On 14 February 2022, overnight, Al Shabaab militants attacked the Southwest Special Police forces (SWSPF) at a checkpoint in Bulo Jameeco area of Hawlwadag village neighborhood in Baidoa town (Baydhaba, Bay). A police officer was killed, and his weapon and ammunition taken. A civilian man was injured by a stray bullet from the attack. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.
Movement of forces: On 14 February 2022, Al Shabaab militants movement was observed towards Beer-Gadiid village (Belet Weyne, Hiraan). The militants performed Maghrib Prayer then started preaching.

On 14 February 2022, the house of the parents of one of the candidates for Migori governor, Robert Kennedy Okong'o, was set alight, with them locked inside, in a suspected politically motivated attack in Komolo Rume Village, within Awendo (Awendo, Migori county). Neighbors' assisted them to get out. [size=no report]

actor1: Police Forces of Tanzania (1964-) Prison Guards
notes: On 14 February 2022, prison guards beat and killed a man, accused of theft of clothing and money, while in custody in Tabora (Tabora Urban, Tabora).

On 14 February 2022, local residents demonstrated demanding the release of journalist in Ceerigaabo town (Ceerigaabo, Sanaag). The journalist who was arrested in August 2021 for accusing Abaarso school of spreading Christianity and believed to be critical to the government of Somaliland. The Somaliland police fired teargas canisters and warning shots (live bullets not specified) to dispersed the crowd. [size=no report]

On 14 February 2022, port police arrested and beat a man for allegedly trying to kidnap a director general in Toamasina (Toamasina I, Atsinanana) after the man was caught and tortured in a Tuc-Tuc by the bodyguards of the director general. The man was admitted to a hospital and received medical certificate for 21 days due to his injuries.

notes: On 14 February 2022, a mob lynched two men in Uvarire village near Kangaru (Mbeere North, Embu County) for allegedly attacking and injuring a woman. [size=no report]

Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.

On 13 February 2022, football fans clashed with Gor Mahia security stewards in Kasarani stadium (Kasarani, Nairobi County), over payment of the requisite entry charge of 200 shillings. Two fans and one guard were rushed to hospital after sustaining head injuries in the scuffle. [size=no report]

On 1 February 2022, Al Shabaab militants abducted a local clan elder from Gubataay village (Doolow, Gedo). The motive behind the abduction of the clan elder is unclear yet; he was called by the militants for a meeting in Ceel Cadde a couple of days before but did not attend.
On 1 February 2022, an unspecified clan militia shot and injured a civilian in Galinsoor village (Cadaado, Galgaduud). The motive was due to clan revenge.

On 1 February 2022, armed man from Habar Gedir-Saad sub-clan militia shot and killed a civilian from the same clan in the southern part of Gaalkacyo town (Gaalkacyo, Mudug). The motive was due to a land dispute.
On 1 February 2022, two farmers were killed in Dano kebelle by unidentified armed gunmen. Location could not be found, coded to Gelana (West Gujji, Oromia).

On 1 February 2022, Amhara ethnic militias attacked civilians and killed 13 people in Adila Dale kebele (coded to Seyo, Dano woreda, West Shewa, Oromia), displacing over hundreds of people from the area.

The Islamic state claimed the attack and that 60 houses were destroyed by arson and six boats were stolen but not mentioning any fatalities.

The group accused the boat management for failing to consult them before launching the new boat. Police (Kenya Coast Guard Services) intervened to quell the situation. [size=no report]

Both sides exchanged heavy gunfire. Two soldiers were killed and 18 others injured. 20 militants were also reported killed. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-2022) Special Forces
notes: On 25 January 2022, government security forces (Danab/Bancroft) in an operation clashed with Al Shabaab militants, taking over Xawaadleey village (Balcad, Middle Shabelle), and Jameeco Misra village (coded separately). Ten militants were killed. Fatalities spilt across two events.

On 25 January 2022, overnight, Al Shabaab militants attacked government security forces (SNA) at a defensive base in Garbahaarey town (Garbahaarey, Gedo). There were no fatalities. One soldier was injured. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.

On 24 January 2022, a group of youths demonstrated at the district head office in Koboko (Kiboko, Northern), for allegedly being denied jobs after sitting for interviews. The demonstrators claimed they were denied jobs because they refused to bribe the district service commission officials. [size=no report]

On 24 January 2022, Lwengo residents blocked Mbarara highway (through unclear means) in protest over power outage in Lwengo District (Central). The outage has gone up to two months, which residents say, has greatly affected their businesses. Police fired live bullets (assumed in the air given to casualties) to disperse the residents. [size=no report]

On 24 January 2022, Makerere University Business School students peacefully protested at Makerere University (Kampala, Central), over missing marks from the previous semester. The university halted the exams following protests. [size=no report]
On 24 January 2022, a group of government legislators demonstrated on bicycles at Parliament Avenue in Kampala (Kampala, Central) against high fuel prices in the country. [size=no report]

On 24 January 2022, Ramula secondary school students together with local residents stormed Ramula police post near Yala (Gem, Siaya County), pelting the officers with stones and other crude weapons. The incident was sparked in demonstration against the death of their teacher under unclear circumstances. The police shot and killed one man and another suffered serious bullet wounds in the ensuing melee. [size=no report]

source: News24 (South Africa); Nyasa Times (Malawi); Malawi Times; Maravi Post; Nation (Malawi); Maravi Express; Face of Malawi; Malawi24; Capital Radio Malawi
notes: Other: On 24 January 2022, President Lazarus Chakwera (MCP) dissolved his cabinet following meetings with government watchdog groups who criticized his inaction regarding the fight against corruption in the country and audio leaks from the Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) Director General discussing suspected practices of public officials. By 28 January, a new cabinet had been formed. Location coded to the capital, Lilongwe (Lilongwe City, Central).

The prisoners damaged offices and the prison gate, though military forces fired weapons (presumed to have been fired in the air), which is implied to have brought an end to the riot. On 24 January 2022, an IED planted by Islamic State militants detonated, targeting a vehicle belonging to a private business company that imports detergents/soap flakes named 'B29' at the Bakaaro market in Mogadishu - Hawl Wadaag (Banadir). There were no casualties. The militants started demanding extortion money called 'Zakat' from businesses and private companies in Mogadishu's Bakaaro market.

Dwellings were torched and around 2,500-2,600 head of cattle were stolen.

On 23 January 2022, an unknown assailant threw a grenade into a traditional dancing ceremony (implied to be Lotuko) at an unspecified location in Loronyo boma (Torit county, Eastern Equatoria state). One person was killed and three wounded. There is no clear motive for the attack, though one source speculates that the assailant may have been drunk.
Property destruction: On 23 January 2022, Al Shabaab militants fired and detonated explosives at a parking lot of a Chinese Construction Company in Bodhei (Lamu West, Lamu county), burning 8 trucks.

On 23 January 2022, local residents staged a peaceful demonstration and blocked (through unspecified means) the Kitale-Lodwar highway near Lodwar town (Turkana Central, Turkana), following the killing of an 11-year-old boy and 31 sheep in a road accident. The protesters demanded compensation. [size=no report]

source: Twitter; Cabo Ligado; VOA; Carta de Mocambique; AIM
notes: On 2 January 2022, members of an Islamist militia attacked civilians in Nangororo in the district of Meluco (Meluco, Cabo Delgado). Houses were burned and goods were seized from local shops. Casualties unknown.

assoc_actor_2: Bor Clan Group (South Sudan); Christian Group (South Sudan); Dinka Ethnic Group (South Sudan); Refugees/IDPs (South Sudan)
notes: On 2 January 2022, fighting was reported among Bor Dinka IDPs attending a service at the Episcopal church in Mingkaman town (Awerial county, Lakes state), in violence which is linked to a power struggle within the church that surfaced in 2020. The county commissioner says the two groups were split between the Akurdid and Anur sections. Ten people have been arrested. [size=no report]

Nine soldiers were killed and three others were injured. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.

notes: On 2 January 2022, government security forces (SNA) and Hirshabelle police attacked Abukar Haji Warsame Xuud and Nur Dheere militias in Ceel Gaal village (Belet Weyne, Hiraan). Four people were killed and ten others were injured. Hiraan governor was part of the operation. The clan militia are opposing Hirshabelle administration.

On 2 January 2022, Al Shabaab militants carried out an attack against government security forces (SNA) at a defensive base in Almada village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). The fighting was initiated with RPG followed by an exchange of heavy gunfire. There were no casualties.

On 2 January 2022, Al Shabaab militants carried out an attack against government security forces (SNA) at a defensive on the bridge in Janaale (Marka, Lower Shabelle). The fighting was initiated with RPG followed by an exchange of heavy gunfire. There were no casualties.

source: BBC News; Jornal Ikweli; Carta de Mocambique; Cabo Ligado; VOA; Twitter; AIM
notes: On 1 January 2022, members of an Islamist militia attacked civilians in Nova Zambezia (Macomia, Cabo Delgado). At least three people were killed. One person was shot and died of his injuries and two people were beheaded. One victim was a (Christian) religious leader. Food was seized by the Islamist militia. The Islamic State claimed the attack.

On 1 January 2022, a suicide bomber using an UVIED suspected to be from Al Shabaab militants detonated, at Bar-Ubah intersection in Mogadishu - Hawl Wadaag (Banadir). The driver died in the blast and two bystanders sustained serious injuries.

On 1 January 2022, about 20 people threw stones against members of the Western Anti-Drug Squad to repel a patrol in Chebel in Beau Bassin-Rose Hill (Plaines Wilhems) after the arrest of a man who carried 18 packages of synthetic drugs. [size=about 20]

actor1: OLF: Oromo Liberation Front (Shane Splinter Faction)
notes: On 1 January 2022, 5 civilians were killed by OLF-Shane fighters in Horo Gudru Wellega zone (coded to zone capital, Shambu, Horo Gudru Wellega, Oromia).

On 1 January 2022, residents demonstrated by carrying placards demanding the resignation of police who killed a civilian and release of arrested residents at the Mbalala Police Station in Mukono District (Central). Police fired teargas to disperse the demonstrators. A demonstrator was arrested. [size=no report]

actor1: Police Forces of Uganda (1986-) Prison Guards
notes: On 1 January 2022, police forces beat to death two suspected murderers from two different prisons in Kachumbala (Bukedea, Eastern).The Mbale Regional Referral Hospital indicated that the two died from the injuries inflicted to them. Police claimed the two committed suicide.

On 1 January 2022, a group of people from the village of Beandrazona looted about 28 houses and set fire to seven houses in Ambalapaka in the district of Bealanana [coded to Ambatoriha-Est] (Amba, Bealanana, Sofia) in retaliation as people from the village killed the coach of a football team the previous day. [size=no report]

On 1 January 2022, members of an Islamist militia attacked civilians in Imbada (Meluco, Cabo Delgado). Houses were burned and goods were seized from local shops. Casualties unknown. The Islamic State claimed the attack.

On 1 January 2022, a remote controlled IED by Al Shabaab militants detonated, targeting an Ethiopia forces water tanker (non-AMISOM) travelling along the Kalabeyr-Feerfeer road, in the vicinity of Feerfeer village (Belet Weyne, Hiraan). Al Shabaab claimed ten soldiers were killed and 15 others injured.

Around 1 January 2022 (as reported), police shot and killed a young man (university student) and placed the body in the back of the car near Kayole (Embakasi Central, Nairobi County). The motive of the attack remains unknown.

Around 1 January 2022, Dongotono militia attacked members of the Lotuko ethnic group at one or more locations in the Lobira area of Ikotos county (Eastern Equatoria state). Five people were killed in total during attacks launched by Dongotono and Lotuko militias around the time (five fatalities split across two events).

On 1 January 2022, suspected Balanda militia were reported to have killed three Zande youth in the area of Manguru along the Tambura-Yambio road (Tambura county, Western Equatoria state) [coded to Nabia 2]. Proxy violence involving militias from the two communities has taken place in the Tambura area in much of 2021.

Around 1 January 2022, Lotuko militia attacked members of the Dongotono ethnic group at one or more unspecified locations (assumed to be in the north-west of Ikotos county, Eastern Equatoria state, and coded to Lomogoro). Five people were killed in total during attacks launched by Dongotono and Lotuko militias around the time (five fatalities split across two events).
On 1 January 2022, suspected Marakwet cattle rustlers attacked Cheptulel village (Pokot Central, West Pokot County). Four people were killed. No further details.
On 1 January 2022, a boda boda taxi rider was killed after his motorcycle ran over an IED, set by suspected Al Shabaab militants, on the road in Kiunga (Lamu East, Lamu county).

notes: Looting: Around 1 January 2022 (month of), Imbonerakure attacked and looted 400 000 BIF from a business woman on Rwingoma hill (Buhiga, Karuzi). The perpetrator was arrested.

On 1 January 2022, security forces [assumed police] loyal to the deputy political chairman of Deynile district and sector chairman of Daru-Salaam neighborhood engaged in an exchange of heavy gunfire in Mogadishu - Daynile (Banadir). Five people were killed and others were injured. The reason behind the fighting was over a land dispute.
